titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Edith Wharton "La Duchessa in Preghiera" Corrected Manuscript, after 1900 RL.11054
titlestmt.author: Alice L. Poffinberger

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-07-05 12:04:41 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Edith Wharton "La Duchessa in Preghiera" corrected manuscript
did.abstract: Collection comprises Edith Wharton's corrected Italian manuscript (34 typed pages) for her short story, "La Duchessa in Preghiera" (The Duchess at Prayer), originally published in English in Scribner's Magazine, August 1900, then by Scribner's in the collection of her stories, "Crucial Instances," 1901. The corrections are in Italian and are in Wharton's own hand.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Edith Wharton was an American novelist, short story writer, and designer. She was born Edith Newbold Jones on 24 Jan. 1862 in New York City; she died 11 Aug. 1937 in Val d'Oise, France.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Edith Wharton "La Duchessa in Preghiera" Corrected Manuscript, after 1900 was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2017.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Edith Wharton "La Duchessa in Preghiera" Corrected Manuscript, after 1900, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Alice L. Poffinberger, May 2015.
Accessions described in this collection guide: 2015-0050-LUBMSS561.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection comprises Edith Wharton's corrected Italian manuscript (34 typed pages) for her short story, "La Duchessa in Preghiera" (The Duchess at Prayer), originally published in English in Scribner's Magazine, August 1900, then by Scribner's in the collection of her stories, "Crucial Instances," 1901. The corrections are in Italian and are in Wharton's own hand.
